nodes.bodyText: Based on the travis error, we may need to use an ENV var for this. If so, we should use a different env var name than 'DATABASE_URL' , e.g. 'TEST_DATABASE_URL' and configure travis to use the new env var name. That way the test database will never be confused for another environment's database.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ test:
   # The password associated with the postgres role (username).
   password: <%= ENV.fetch("DB_PASS", nil) %>
 
-  url: <%= ENV.fetch("DATABASE_URL", "postgresql://localhost/dpc-website_test") %>
+  url: "postgresql://localhost/dpc-website_test"

nodes.bodyText:
So under test put url: <%= ENV.fetch("TEST_DATABASE_URL", the url) %>
How do we configure travis?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ test:
   # The password associated with the postgres role (username).

-  url: <%= ENV.fetch("DATABASE_URL", "postgresql://localhost/dpc-website_test") %>
+  url: "postgresql://localhost/dpc-website_test"
